alert.note: Alert for Payne (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 17 at 11:59PM CDT until June 18 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN SEMINOLE...EASTERN LINCOLN...SOUTHEASTERN PAYNE AND NORTHEASTERN POTTAWATOMIE COUNTIES... At 1159 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 3 miles southeast of Osage to near Kellyville to 4 miles northeast of Boley, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Cushing, Stroud, Prague, Yale, Meeker, Davenport, Sparks, Kendrick, Quay, Avery, and Centerview. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
